summary: This is a transcript of an FBI interview conducted on May 4, 2021, with a female reflexologist and psychotherapist who provided services at Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico from approximately 1999 to 2008. She describes her limited interactions with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, her observations of young women at the ranch, and being asked to sign a non-disclosure agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI investigation. The interviewee provided reflexology services to him a few times at Zorro Ranch between 1999 and 2008.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The main client of the interviewee at Zorro Ranch. Described as Epstein's companion and the manager of his properties. Received reflexology treatments frequently.

persons.name: Unnamed Interviewee
persons.context: A licensed professional clinical counselor and certified reflexologist who provided foot reflexology services to Ghislaine Maxwell and, infrequently, to Jeffrey Epstein at Zorro Ranch. She is being interviewed by the FBI.

persons.name: Unnamed FBI Special Agent 1
persons.context: One of the two FBI agents conducting the interview. Leads the questioning about the interviewee's experiences at Zorro Ranch.

persons.name: Unnamed FBI Special Agent 2 (UM1)
persons.context: The second FBI agent present during the interview. Assists with questioning and shows photographs to the witness.

persons.name: Unnamed Massage Therapist Colleague
persons.context: A peer and colleague of the interviewee, also a psychotherapist, who originally referred the interviewee to provide reflexology services at Zorro Ranch. She was a massage therapist for Epstein/Maxwell.

persons.name: Unnamed Young Massage Therapist
persons.context: A young, attractive female massage therapist employed by Epstein whom the interviewee was asked to train in reflexology during one session.

persons.name: Unnamed Housekeeper(s)
persons.context: A couple (male and female) who managed the Zorro Ranch house. They would coordinate the interviewee's visits, escort her, and were described as lovely. The interviewee was shown a photo and tentatively identified one.

connections.description: Described by the witness as companions, possibly in a relationship, with Maxwell managing Epstein's properties.
The interviewee provided regular reflexology services to Ghislaine Maxwell at Zorro Ranch from 1999 to 2008.
The interviewee provided reflexology services to Jeffrey Epstein on approximately three occasions over the same period.
Colleagues in psychotherapy and bodywork. The colleague referred the interviewee to the Zorro Ranch client.
The colleague worked as a massage therapist for Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The housekeepers were staff who managed the Zorro Ranch home and coordinated visits for service providers like the interviewee.
The young woman was a massage therapist employed by Epstein who traveled with him.

events.title: First Reflexology Treatment at Zorro Ranch
events.description: The interviewee provided her first reflexology treatment at Zorro Ranch, initiated by her colleague.

events.title: Last Reflexology Treatment at Zorro Ranch
events.description: The interviewee provided her last reflexology service at Zorro Ranch, ceasing her work there.

events.title: Period of Service at Zorro Ranch
events.description: The interviewee provided reflexology services sporadically at Zorro Ranch over this nine-year period, primarily to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Non-Disclosure Agreement Proposal
events.description: The interviewee was asked to sign a contract (described as a 'celebrity contract') requiring confidentiality about anything seen at Zorro Ranch, with a potential $250,000 penalty for violation. She refused to sign.

events.title: Observation of Young Women Arriving
events.description: On one occasion, the interviewee observed several young women (estimated age 18 or under) arriving at the ranch, possibly from a plane or helicopter. They were described as young, attractive, and potentially connected to The Limited or Victoria's Secret.

events.title: Training Session for Massage Therapist
events.description: During a session with Jeffrey Epstein, he asked a young female massage therapist to observe so the interviewee could teach her reflexology techniques.

locations: Stanley, New Mexico (mentioned as a landmark)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (mentioned regarding colleague's house)
Manhattan, New York (mentioned as another location of Epstein/Maxwell property)
keyFacts: The witness, a reflexologist, provided services primarily to Ghislaine Maxwell at Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Ranch from approximately 1999 to 2008, seeing Epstein only about three times.
She observed a group of young women (estimated age 18 or under) arriving at the ranch on one occasion, who she thought might be aspiring models connected to The Limited or Victoria's Secret.
She was asked to sign a non-disclosure agreement with a $250,000 penalty clause for violating confidentiality about anything seen at the ranch; she refused to sign.
She described the staff, including housekeepers and a young female massage therapist she was asked to train, and noted that there was a rule that staff or service providers had to be 'attractive.'

She stated she never witnessed any of the abusive conduct Epstein is accused of, and her interactions with both Epstein and Maxwell were professional, though she noted Epstein once wore only a bathrobe during a session.
